abstract.p: Edward J Prenner letter disputes Victor Navasky's Oct 21 article on Gus Hall, late American Communist Party leader

block.p: In ''My Hunt for Moscow Gold,'' about Gus Hall, the late American Communist Party leader (Op-Ed, Oct. 21), Victor Navasky commits the same sin of moral equivalency that has been a stain on the American left since the beginning of the cold war. He says ''the Communists were not the only lawbreakers'' and refers in typical fashion to American ''paranoia'' about Communism.

In ''My Hunt for Moscow Gold,'' about Gus Hall, the late American Communist Party leader (Op-Ed, Oct. 21), Victor Navasky commits the same sin of moral equivalency that has been a stain on the American left since the beginning of the cold war. He says ''the Communists were not the only lawbreakers'' and refers in typical fashion to American ''paranoia'' about Communism.

McCarthy was a scoundrel; Stalin was a monster. American anti-Communism disrupted the lives of scores of people and did a disservice to democracy. Soviet Communism eradicated the lives of scores of millions and destroyed democracy. There is no moral equivalency.
EDWARD J. PRENNER Forest Hills, Queens, Oct. 21, 2000
